main event: On May 25, 1959, in Farmington, Michigan, a reliable sales manager for American Import Co. observed two oblong objects the size of half dollars at an altitude of 5000 ft. The objects, bright snow-colored and with dark bottoms, disappeared into clouds while traveling in a straight line. The observation lasted approximately 5 seconds.
interesting points: The observer estimated the reliability of the sighting as reliable.
The objects were very bright and appeared blue dark on the bottom.
The sighting was compared to a flight of birds, but no adequate explanation was found.
There was no physical evidence, and local OSI and ACH squadron gave negative reports.
Surrounding terrain lit up in brilliant blue-green light to a height of about 300 feet during a separate alleged UFO sighting.
sighted object: two oblong objects the size of half dollars
witnesses: sales manager for American Import Co.
